description: Part single, part two storey rear extension; two storey side extension; alteration of roof from hip to gable ends; rear roof extension to main rear roof slope, extending over proposed part single, part two storey rear extension; construction of balcony to second floor rear elevation; front porch extension; and single storey detached outbuilding (following demolition of existing outbuildings)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: 1019B010 REV P2 (existing location & site plan), 1019B011 REV P2 (existing level 0 & level 1), 1019B012 REV P2 (existing roof plan), 1019B020 REV P2 (existing north & east elevations), 1019B021 REV P2 (existing south & west elevations), 1019B030 REV P2 (existing sections), 1019B031 REV P1 (existing site section), 1019B041 REV P2 (existing axonometric view 1), 1019B042 REV P2 (existing axonometric view 2), 1019B043 REV P2 (existing axonometric view 3), 1019B044 REV P2 (existing axonometric view 4), 1019B110 REV P11 (proposed location & site plan), 1019B111 REV P10 (proposed level 0 & level 1), 1019B112 REV P11 (main house- proposed floor plans level 02 & roof), 1019B113 REV P8 (outbuilding - proposed floor plans & sections), 1019B120 REV P11 (main house - proposed north & east sections), 1019B121 REV P11 (main house - proposed south & west elevations), 1019B122 REV P8 (outbuilding - proposed elevations), 1019B130 REV P11 (main house - proposed sections), 1019B131 REV P8 (proposed site section), 1019B141 REV P11 (proposed axonometric view 1), 1019B142 REV P11 (proposed axonometric view 2), 1019B143 REV P11 (proposed axonometric view 3) & 1019B144 REV 11 (proposed axonometric view 4).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | No part of the roof of the ground floor rear extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, 1.8m high timber privacy screens shall be installed to side facing aspects of the balcony at the second floor rear elevation.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | The seven (7) proposed windows to the west facade of the main house and one (1) window to the west facade of the outbuilding shall contain only obscure glass and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7m from floor level.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), policies Local variation to policy 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1, 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012). | The hereby approved detached rear outbuilding shall only be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the dwellinghouse, and shall not be used for habitable accommodation, as an independent dwelling or any industrial, commercial or business use.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order), the development hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
